items.content_html:
This fixes a few issues I saw in https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/Getting_started_with_the_web/JavaScript_basics.

  • don't talk about var
  • remove a pile of note boxes
  • remove list formatting for some code samples
  • use addEventListener rather than on*
  • mention arrow functions
  • fix a link flaw
items.title: Fix issues in JS basics article

Motivation

The code sample did not seem to make sense, so I consulted the linked code sample and discovered the snippet did not reflect the sample.

items.content_html:
Summary

HTTP response status codes.

  • 102 Processing
  • 207 Multi-Status
  • 208 Already Reported
  • 226 IM Used
  • 421 Misdirected Request
  • 423 Locked
  • 424 Failed Dependency
    were missing in the list. So they were added.

Motivation

This will be my very first contribution towards MDN. I used it as a major resource of learning so now with this I want to be part of the MDN network and help it grow more effectively

Supporting details

Related issues

Fixes #12591

items.content_html:
This PR updates VideoTrackList for new-style event pages. (see the template)

To deduplicate the pages, I used these commands:

yarn content delete Web/API/VideoTrackList/onaddtrack --redirect=/en-US/docs/Web/API/VideoTrackList/addtrack_event
yarn content delete Web/API/VideoTrackList/onremovetrack --redirect=/en-US/docs/Web/API/VideoTrackList/removetrack_event
yarn content delete Web/API/VideoTrackList/onchange --redirect=/en-US/docs/Web/API/VideoTrackList/change_event

BCD is approved in mdn/browser-compat-data#13885

items.content_html:
Bumps @mdn/yari from 0.6.30 to 0.6.39.

Commits
  • 3fcbca1 Browser compatibility table: revise preview legend copy (#5224)
  • 2d1f9ec build(deps): bump boto3 from 1.20.41 to 1.20.46 in /deployer (#5220)
  • a5bebdd build(deps): bump unidiff from 0.7.0 to 0.7.2 in /deployer (#5218)
  • 86e314a (chore:browserlist) update browserlist (#5213)
  • afd0257 build(deps-dev): bump @​playwright/test from 1.18.0 to 1.18.1 (#5214)
  • e32ca93 build(deps): bump browser-specs from 2.22.0 to 2.23.0 (#5212)
  • 6c21eeb build(deps): bump @​mdn/browser-compat-data from 4.1.4 to 4.1.5 (#5211)
  • e351b86 Add "preview" statement to BCD legend (#5207)
  • 2df5420 Trim "≤" sign from version when searching for browser release date (#5194)
  • 298f3b2 Added Japanese Translations (#4696)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting @dependabot rebase.

Dependabot commands and options

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:

  • @dependabot rebase will rebase this PR
  • @dependabot recreate will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it
  • @dependabot merge will merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot squash and merge will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot cancel merge will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging
  • @dependabot reopen will reopen this PR if it is closed
  • @dependabot close will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually
  • @dependabot ignore this major version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this minor version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this dependency will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
items.title: Bump @mdn/yari from 0.6.30 to 0.6.39

items.content_html:
Summary

There are two use cases on the css file example, with descendant combinator li li and without li. the HTML is repeated (contains only the use case of li li) and therefor the result is repeated.

Motivation

I believe it makes more sense to show how the result would look using the descendant combinator and not using it.

Metadata

  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Update HTML example in descendant combinator

items.content_html:
Summary

This wraps children of MathML <mtd> cells into an <mrow> group, except for the mtable and mtd articles:

find files/ -type f -name '*.md' | grep -v mtable/index.md | grep -v mtd/index.md | xargs sed -i 's|<mtd>|<mtd><mrow>|g;s|</mtd>|</mrow></mtd>|g'

Per the MathML specifications, there should be no rendering change. However Firefox does perform line breaking inside MathML table cells when the explicit <mrow> is absent (and does not otherwise). Note that this change is really only useful when the <mtd> element contains at least two children, but it's easier to write a command line if the remaining cases are included too.

Motivation

Users reported broken rendering in Firefox on twitter. Adding an explicit <mrow> prevents undesired line breaking inside MathML table cells.

Supporting details

twitter thread where the issue was reported
fix for the missing parentheses

Related issues

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Wrap children of <mtd> elements into an <mrow> to prevent line breaking.

items.content_html:
This PR updates the Serial API for new-style event pages. (see the template)

Commands used:

yarn content move Web/API/SerialPort/onconnect Web/API/SerialPort/connect_event
yarn content move Web/API/SerialPort/ondisconnect Web/API/SerialPort/disconnect_event
yarn content delete Web/API/Serial/onconnect --redirect=/en-US/docs/Web/API/SerialPort/connect_event 
yarn content delete Web/API/Serial/ondisconnect --redirect=/en-US/docs/Web/API/SerialPort/disconnect_event

As discussed in mdn/browser-compat-data#13925, SerialPort bubbles to Serial and so I documented these two events only under SerialPort and the Serial page just contains them as links but not as sub pages to avoid duplication.
items.title: Update Serial API for new-style event pages

items.content_html:
Summary

Fix the polyfill of Math.fround that does not rely on Float32Array.

Motivation

As shown here:
https://gist.github.com/shicks/7a97ec6b3f10212e60a89a7f6d2d097d?permalink_comment_id=4048135#gistcomment-4048135
the old polyfill was incorrect, because it was breaking ties upwards when rounding. The spec of fround requires to break ties to even instead.

The new polyfill correctly breaks ties to even, even at the critical points of transitioning from subnormal to normal forms, and from finite to infinity.

To perform ties-to-even, the code relies on the natural rounding that will happen when getting into the subnormal forms of (64-bit) numbers.

In addition, the new polyfill does not assume that Math.log will always return the best approximation. The spec of Math.log explicitly says that it may not return the best approximation.

Supporting details

  • The gist with the old polyfill, with the test cases that break, and the new implementation: https://gist.github.com/shicks/7a97ec6b3f10212e60a89a7f6d2d097d?permalink_comment_id=4048135#gistcomment-4048135
  • The new polyfill is the one used by Scala.js. In the Scala.js codebase, it is written as a JS AST here. Its tests are here

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Fix the polyfill of Math.fround.
